summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on July 7, 2020, to an unnamed attorney. It commands the production of documents related to the purchase of a property by Granite Realty, LLC, and specifically requests records referencing Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoena is part of an investigation into violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and signed the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Explicitly named in the subpoena rider as a person for whom all related records must be produced in connection with the property transaction investigation.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the grand jury investigation that is seeking records related to Maxwell.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date the subpoenaed attorney is commanded to appear before the grand jury, unless records are produced beforehand.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of a federal grand jury investigation into suspected violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2423(a) (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity), and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement).
The investigation is seeking all non-privileged documents related to the purchase of a specific property by 'Granite Realty, LLC,' including records referencing Ghislaine Maxwell.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that the recipient attorney voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The subpoena has a broad scope, covering documents wherever they may be found, including on computers, servers, and personal electronic devices, whether in the U.S. or any foreign jurisdiction.
The recipient is identified only as 'Attorney at Law,' and the specific property address is redacted as 'H.'
